newsitem.title: UK: LPC - Mercury One 2 One seeks 1.2 bln stg loan.
newsitem.headline: LPC - Mercury One 2 One seeks 1.2 bln stg loan.

text.p: LONDON, Aug 23 (LPC) - Mercury One 2 One has asked its lead banks to arrange a 1.2 billion stg syndicated loan, according to bankers close to the deal. The credit will be arranged by Citibank, HSBC Investment Bank, and Banque Paribas.
Pricing on the eight-year loan is expected to be 150 bps over LIBOR.

Mercury One 2 One, a joint venture partnership between Cable and Wireless Plc and U S West Inc, last came to the market in November 1995. That deal was for 600 million stg and had a maturity of seven years and pricing of 150 bps over LIBOR.
Arranged by HSBC and Paribas, the credit was about 30 percent oversubscribed but not increased.
"I can't provide any numbers, but I can confirm that we are looking to extend our debt facility," said a Mercury One 2 One spokeswoman.
